author: Chris Rowson

text: Quick education lesson from someone who has invested in bitcoin since 2011. The technology in bitcoin is not worth investing anymore. The price is far too high at this point to even make a profit as people have in the past. Lets say you hope to double up your money or more because you've heard all these stories about people making 10000x time their investment RIGHT?! well at this point, bitcoin is sooo overpriced at $13k (at the time im writing this comment) yes it was $20k a few weeks ago. Look everyone, at $13k PER bitcoin, you will need to have an entire bitcoin and then bank on the market to double to $26k per bitcoin just to double your money in todays market! That is an insane stretch just to double your investment. 2 weeks ago I bought $500 of bitcoin and immediately from the moment I bought it and then traded it to Bitrex ( a different crypto wallet exhange market) I lost $50 in fees alone and then it took 8hours just to reach Bitrex! A few days later I bought $500 in Etherum since both coins are on coinbase. I was charged only $4 between coinbase fees and transfer fees and it took 25mins to reach Bitrex! Im not here telling people to invest in etherum either but ALT-coins is where you wanna look for 95% of investors that read these fancy stories of get rich within a year or 2 stories thats creating all this hype. Cryptocurrency market cap is the website you wanna look at on a daily basis. Bitcoin is an amazing coin but it is past its time to invest into to sit on and make tons of money, its just over for that purpose. No coin would be possible today without bitcoins technology or hype but its time to look into etherum, ripple, litecoin, any ALT-coin. Hell, last year I threw $100 at ripple when it was worth .007C (thats not even a penny per ripple) and I got a large amount which people then were saying would take years to reach $1 but here we are and it hit $3 a week ago. Nobody knows what prices are going to look like. Ive heard bitcoin was gonna bubble at $1k, then it was 2K and then 3K and so on, now look it hit 20k and now its at 13k. The market is so unpredictable but bitcoin is sooo overpriced you wont make enough money to brag about at this point. I threw $20 at dogecoin (which everyone considers the JOKE of cryptos) a month ago when it was .0004 each and not its worth .01c which is huge gains but still extremely inexpensive. You dont need to break your bank with your investment, Just do a little research and take a guess and throw a reasonable amount of money at some alt-coins and wait out the roller coaster of ups and downs and see some major profits. TRUST ME GUYS!!﻿

text:
what to know about BITCOIN : 
A lot of monkeys lived near a village.🐒
One day a merchant came to the village to buy these monkeys!
He announced that he will buy the monkeys @ $100 each. 🐵💵

The villagers thought that this man is mad.
They thought how can somebody buy stray monkeys at $100 each?

Still, some people caught some monkeys and gave it to this merchant and he gave $100 for each monkey. 
This news spread like wildfire and people caught monkeys and sold it to the merchant.

After a few days, the merchant announced that he will buy monkeys @ 200 each. 🐵💵
The lazy villagers also ran around to catch the remaining monkeys!🐒
They sold the remaining monkeys @ 200 each.😋

Then the merchant announced that he will buy monkeys @ 500 each!💵💵
The villagers start to lose sleep! ... They caught six or seven monkeys, which was all that was left and got 500 each.🙊🐵
The villagers were waiting anxiously for the next announcement.

Then the merchant announced that he is going home to visit his wife for a week.  And when he returns, he will buy monkeys @ 1000 each!🐵💵💵💵💵💵
The merchant asked his employee to take care of the monkeys he bought.  The employee was alone taking care of all the monkeys in a cage, while the merchant went home to visit his wife.
The villagers were very sad as there were no more monkeys left for them to sell it at $1000 each, they looked everywhere!!

Then the employee told them that he will sell some monkeys @ 700 each secretly. 
This news spread like fire.  Since the merchant buys monkey @ 1000 each, there is a 300 profit for each monkey.

The next day, villagers made a queue near the monkey cage.🐒🐒🐒🐒

The employee sold all the monkeys at 700 each.  The rich bought monkeys in big lots.  The poor borrowed money from money lenders and also bought monkeys!
🐒🐒🐒💵💵💵💵💵💵💵💵💵💵💵

The villagers took care of their monkeys & waited for the merchant to return. 

1 week pasted but nobody came! ...Then they ran to the employee....

But he has already left too !

The villagers then realized that they have bought the useless stray monkeys @ 700 each and unable to sell them! 😩😫😨😰😭😭😭😭😭😭

The Bitcoin will be the next monkey business 

It will make a lot of people bankrupt and a few people filthy rich in this monkey business. 🐒😉﻿

author: iTouchAppReviewers

text:
Crytpcurrency and more specifically Bitcoin have been quite the notable topic lately with its rising value, but the story is not all positive. Aside from the ability to completely hide financial transactions for nefarious activity, the energy use for these transactions is almost off the charts.
The numbers in this article are simply stunning.
"Today, each bitcoin transaction requires the same amount of energy used to power nine homes in the US for one day. And miners are constantly installing more and faster computers. Already, the aggregate computing power of the bitcoin network is nearly 100,000 times larger than the world’s 500 fastest supercomputers combined.
The total energy use of this web of hardware is huge—an estimated 31 terawatt-hours per year. More than 150 individual countries in the world consume less energy annually. And that power-hungry network is currently increasing its energy use every day by about 450 gigawatt-hours, roughly the same amount of electricity the entire country of Haiti uses in a year."

https://www.wired.com/story/bitcoin-mining-guzzles-energyand-its-carbon-footprint-just-keeps-growing/﻿

author: RousingLight

text:
1. Don't invest more than you are willing to lose
2. Do research: understand the technology, read the whitepaper, investigate the dev team
3. Google 2FA (2-factor authentication) -- this is REQUIRED so you don't get effed over
4. Only trust well known exchanges with a good track record (e.g. Bittrex, Binance)
5. Don't trust John McAfee
6. Don't trust Reddit
7. Join some Telegram or Slack groups, find people talking sense, befriend them
8. Read up on how to read charts and understand terms (head and shoulders/pennant/etc formation, FUD/FOMO)
9. HODL, don't panic sell
10. If you are about to panic sell, just remember Mel Gibson yelling in the Patriot "hoooollllld the line!!!"

There will be a correction that will wipe out about 80% of what everyone has. This is expected. Refer to #1 if that is what you are afraid of.

Source: $1k investment, currently at $60k profit in 6 months without constant day-trading and purely investing in alt-coins﻿

author: Richard Geddis

text:
Bitcoin is not gambling. Bitcoin is a speculative asset, just like gold.
It gains value because people believe its worth something.
Be conservative when investing into crypto currencies. Only invest as much money as you are okay with loosing 100% of.
Diversification is key. Split up your investment into various different coins, not just all in on BTC, but some mid sized coins, LTC or ETH, and some smaller ones as ADA, IOTA and XMR.
Invest the rest of your money into stocks. Here again, diversify: domestic (e.g. VTI), international (e.g. VEA), emerging markets (e.g. VWO), some dividends (e.g. VIG), and some natural resources (XLE) will build a good portfolio.
But before doing all that, max out your retirement plan, which often holds a tax advantage and an employer contribution, such as a 401k in the States.

Don't expect to become millionaire in a day, that happens only to very few people. Instead, go for the long run.﻿

author: t r

text:
Alpha says he was naive not to invest early, but I don’t agree. There are a lot of things out there a lot of people think will make them a lot of money, and most of them will end up mistaken. There was no reason to believe it would explode in price, and in fact, it probably won’t be around forever given the events unfolding. Plus, the majority of people investing are only putting their money in because it’s going up. There’s no actual value there. These people will sell the moment things start to turn south. It’s a total bubble. 
Bitcoin is nothing more than a speculative asset. In fact, all of the original characteristics it was touted to be revolutionary for it now no longer has. I would be very careful about thinking this is just the beginning. This is the same crap people were saying just before the housing crisis. If there’s anything to be said it’s that anybody who didn’t already own bitcoin have pretty much missed out. I don’t think it will climb much more unless it’s propped up by some massive investor. Now is a dumb time to get in.﻿

author: Michael Bricci

text:
Joseph Kennedy knew it was time to sell his shares in 1929 when a shoe-shine boy gave him stock tips. In 2018 it's a good sign to sell your Bitcoins when a skin-care salesman starts telling you to subscribe to a crypto newsletter.

Here's some free financial advice:
Pay off all non-mortgage debt. Save the equivalent of five months salary in cash. Once you have that, start investing a monthly sum into various low-cost tracker/index funds. Diversify. Focus on the long-term and try not to overtrade. Enjoy life but live within your means.﻿

author: Mike Martin

text:
Do your own research, but in my opinion cryptocurrency right now is what the internet was a few decades ago. It made me more money than I could ever imagine at my age (not even close to being rich but still, I'm happy). A good tip is to look into SONM, it's the most advanced supercomputing network, far superior to Golem and such, and the best thing is that theyre not quite marketing their brand. As soon as big companies start using this technology, we'll see SONM turning into one of the biggest IT corporations in the world. Still, this is my educated opinion, so do your own research.

The best info sources right now are:
* bitcointalk.org
* twitter (follow as much big players and companies as possible (cryptocurrencynews, roger ver, charlee lee, John mcAfee (yes, follow him), every company you're interested in, ...)
* the cryptolark/scrembo paul (great youtube channels)

Do NOT listen to:
* the guy you know from school that bought bitcoin 5 years ago and is telling you now how to get rich quick
* banks (crypto can take down banking, no kidding)

Questions to ask yourself before investing:
*If I lose this money or if it drops for a few weeks/months, would it bother me? No? Good, invest it.
* Does the company I invest in have an experienced team, good advisors, a working prototype, an achievable goal, backing from big names, decent competition (no competition: either revolutionary tech OR people don't want it)
* Am I chasing a train that has already left? Bitcoin isn't going to go x10 in a few months, but smaller coins like Stratis or Sonm could easily achieve that. Ask yourself what kind of results you're looking for, the longer you plan on holding your investment, the bigger the marketcap of the investment should be.

This is over a year of info, boiled down to a few sentences. If you're careful and you don't start chasing nice words and speeding trains, you'll make good money by following these tips.﻿

text:
lol, You are having regret for not getting in when Christian told you, Imagine me, who worked at a computer store, whose co-workers in 2012 were building machines to mine bitcoins and looked at them like wtf is that b.s.

To expand on what was said:
If you get into crypto's, like Alpha said, be smart and conservative.
Stick to what is known and credible for now, such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin, Etc. Basically what is on coinbase ( the major coin exchange )

If you start feeling comfortable, go into alt-coins ( the lesser known ones that have the extreme gains but also can have extreme loses ) but keep the bulk in Bitcoin or one of the more known ones.

Lastly, whether its a known coin or not, do some research into who is using it ( which services, institutions, etc. ) then decide. If you dont know the coin but you just want to play with it and risk, then thats on you.

Crypto's in general will be the future of currency or at least how some forms of payment will be used... that much isnt debated amongst anyone. What is debated is, if it is, or can be a currency...

It's only a matter of time before someone like Amazon starts accepting bitcoin...and when they do, it's to the moon alice!

Goodluck : )﻿

author: MarkAg47

text:
bitcoin possesses every characteristic of every bubble throughout history that i've ever studied - every single one. we see wall street and other speculators try to ascertain a value to cryptos by saying "if X amount of the population buys Y amount of bitcoin it will be worth Z dollars." absolutely asinine stuff. its the same type of "valuation" metrics we saw during the dotcom bubble. the fact is that nobody knows how to value this stuff - because it has no intrinsic value. 
i could get into the nuances of why bitcoin is fundamentally inadequate as a currency, but i dont think it's important in this context. what is important is that people aren't buying cryptos for their utility or to use them as an actual medium of exchange. 
rather, they're buying them as a speculative asset and as a means to get more dollars (even though they're supposed to replace dollars, right?), not bc they believe the bitcoin narrative.﻿

author: PromotingTheBeat

text: You can't lose money in crypto if you are smart, do a wide portfolio in different coins. Just set a stop loss to automatically sell the coins when they drop below a certain threshold and exchange one coin into another when the coin  goes into a dip. Right now bitcoin is in a dip after an all time high, but many coins like WABI have doubled in the last week. Multiply your bitcoin in 10 or so coins that are on the up and then when bitcoin starts moving upwards again put it back into bitcoin and set a stop loss for when bitcoin is back on the decline. You are basically always riding the waves upward this way. Anyone that says not to invest into crypto or even the stock market during a bullish period does not know what they are talking about. If you have 20 different crypto investments and one of them loses money you lose 5% of your total worth, but seeing as it is normal for currencies to make 5%-20% returns a day it's a no-brainer.﻿
